page.title: 16PLAY AREA FOR WESTGATE
page.content: The County Council were planning to make the old railway station at Westgate into a picnic site but the villagers wanted somewhere for children to play instead. They set up PAWS (Play Area for Westgate Scheme) and raised money by having jumble sales, discos, an assault course, a Christmas Pantomime and chopping logs to sell. Grants were given by the Sports Council and County Council. First the site had to be levelled . Then a space bigger than a tennis court was tarmacked and fenced.The station offices have been turned into a club house and the surrounding land has been planted with grass seed and young trees. Children can play football, tennis, basketball, netball and other games on the area. It opens in September 1985.
